full_text: Happy ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt forget to cancel your Peacock subscription‚Äù Day, American Athletics fans!
@popphits @oureric I bet you could catch her on an @concordcoach bus if you got lucky. How else does anyone from Maine get to Logan?
@J_Estes You don‚Äôt *think* he‚Äôs going to call, Jim? https://t.co/geX1hGxr68
I‚Äôve got plenty more where these came from! I‚Äôm by my phone, eagerly awaiting your call, Lord Coe.
Top 5kers get to assign lesser qualifiers the walk of their choice from Monty Python‚Äôs the Ministry of Silly Walks sketch for a lap
Top steeplers can have a shot putter from their nation tackle one competitor in the water pit‚Äîno drowning, but they can definitely hold their head under for a bit!
Top 1500m qualifiers may violently spike a competitor of their choosing (below the waist only‚Äîplease, we‚Äôre not uncivilized)

Could do the same in the 800m as races run fully in lanes. I don‚Äôt think this format makes sense for races 1500m and longer, though. *BUT* that doesn‚Äôt mean we can‚Äôt give top seeds (or prelim performers) in those races advantages in the final, too:
In laned races, 6 heats of 8, winners go straight to the finals. 2nd and 3rd in each of the eight heats compete in two heats of the fastest losers round, winner of each heat goes to the finals.

I‚Äôve long thought that either earning the ‚ÄúBig Q‚Äù (or having a top X qualifying position) should get you a bye out of one of the BS early rounds. Adding repechage is a half-measure towards that‚ÄîI dare them to go all the way.

Tired: Athletics is great, nothing needs to change.

Wired: Athletics is great, but repechage *IN ADDITION* to semifinals is what we need.

Inspired: Athletics is great, but repechage *INSTEAD OF* semifinals is what we need.
@michaelclemons Clemons, we were just talking about you and Nathan‚Ä¶

You think Athletics Twitter is a hot mess? Check out the comments on this ESPN tweet about Athing Mu to see how batshit this app is when our sport breaks out of its little corner (or, if you don‚Äôt want your ears to bleed, don‚Äôt look and just take my word for it). https://t.co/i0CAOK0aCa

How dominant was Team USA at this World Champs? If Jamaica, Ethiopia, and Kenya (who finished 2-3-4 in the team scoring and are all powerhouses in their own right) were one super-country, they still would‚Äôve lost to Team USA by 8 points, 328-320: https://t.co/rFEcxBKMGj
This is an all-time great US Team, with a massive infusion of young talent. It‚Äôs almost a shame that Paris got the ‚Äò24 games.
I wonder if it‚Äôll be cheaper for American Athletics fans from the east coast to get to Hungary next year than it was for them to get to Eugene this year.
Folks, these athletes are sooooo good!
Any way a mixed 4x100m could ever work? Woman-woman-man-man?
The US Men‚Äôs 4x100m team versus the ground is the greatest rivalry in Athletics.

@brendanboyce @WorldAthletics And this was going to be the case when the decision was made. Which makes one wonder whether this was intentional, as an interim step toward reducing the championship walk schedule to one event.
@erinstrout Umm, is there something in the water in Flag? At this point I think I mean this both literally and metaphorically.

When the chase pack catches the lead pack, a common tactic is for chasers to try to freak out the lead pack when overtaking them by yelling ‚Äúoogie boogie boogie!‚Äù We may see this rare and exciting tactic in use today! #MadeUpMarathonFacts

American @emmajbates is running under protest after being called for a false start that was invisible to the naked eye. She almost wasn‚Äôt allowed to run, but common sense prevailed. #MadeUpMarathonFacts
Ruth Chepngetich got confused and thought she woke up in Berlin this morning . . . hence this nuts pace! #MadeUpMarathonFacts
A reminder that they‚Äôre team-scoring this meet, and if it feels like USA has been dominating, maybe this will help explain why: https://t.co/rFEcxBKMGj

@d9monti @JaneMonti1 Not a wild swerve, lands in the range of ‚Äúacceptable‚Äù (although maybe nearer to the line than some here are suggesting). It also makes the case for the sport adding a non-DQ remedy: awarding the obstructing athlete the same time as (and the place behind) the obstructed athlete.
Splitscreen for commercials during the Men‚Äôs 10,000m!!! It *IS* possible!

You may think the caution tape you‚Äôre seeing on course is plastic, but it isn‚Äôt! It‚Äôs made from recycled clove cigarette butts collected along Hawthorne Blvd in SE Portland. #MadeUpMarathonFacts
Eliud Kipchoge was going to compete in today‚Äôs marathon, but decided against it once he saw how much flights and hotels cost. #MadeUpMarathonFacts

The key hard workout Galen Rupp did during his build-up was showing up to the bagel run in Flagstaff while visiting coach Mike Smith and not getting dropped even when some local legends decided to run to the barn. #madeupmarathonfacts

Competitors in today‚Äôs race are required to stop like they‚Äôre playing a game of ‚Äúfreeze dance‚Äù during commercial breaks. If they don‚Äôt remain perfectly still, they will be disqualified. #madeupmarathonfacts

Ser-Od Bat-Ochir ran a 1:58:45 at his first World Championship Marathon, which was so long ago that they hadn‚Äôt yet standardized the marathon distance and had a course that was only 37 and a half kilometers. #madeupmarathonfacts

With the narrow course, @teamusa considered sending @RyanCrouser1 to @runSRA_CIM to manufacture a qualifier for him at the #OTQfactory and then use him as a blocker at strategic points while Rupp made his breaks in today‚Äôs race. #madeupmarathonfacts

Time primes are being given for the first athlete to reach the 5k, 10k, halfway, and 30k marks in today‚Äôs race. To assure the 1st runner across the line is still the winner, the rest of the field is required to stop for the duration of the prime. #madeupmarathonfacts
Little known fact that may come into play today: in championship races, if you catch the lead vehicle you‚Äôre allowed to hop in and hitch a ride for up to 1km. #madeupmarathonfacts
Don‚Äôt have the all clear for the start? Timing hardware issue? What‚Äôs up?

How would we all feel about instituting a formal ‚ÄúAll-World‚Äù honorific for anyone who finishes top-8(?) at an outdoor WCs or Olympics? And an ‚ÄúAll-(Area Name)‚Äù designation for anyone who does the same at their Area Championship)?
Just noticing how kick-ass the pattern on these Kenyan uniform bottoms is‚Ä¶
Okay, I think we should avoid criticizing the coverage as much as possible, but this commercial break is some bullshit‚Ä¶

The hammer throw is a wonderful event, but I always feel like it‚Äôs a missed opportunity when they aren‚Äôt throwing it OVER something‚Äî a canyon, a pool, a bunch of VW buses. Like, give it some NBA Slam Dunk Contest shtick.
Picture in picture for a dramatic field attempt while a track race is going on‚Äîthis feels like what watching the moon landing must have felt like!

Hey Athletics Twitter! Read this @allysonfelix piece and tell me you aren‚Äôt excited to see what she accomplished in her next career. She‚Äôs an all-time great, both on the track AND off: https://t.co/Ja8We2Kvnz

@J_Estes (& I‚Äôm of course assuming the US would perennially take the #1 spot and it would make our Trials/selection event clearer every year. Although maybe that‚Äôs just American hubris on my part‚Ä¶)

@J_Estes Yeah‚Äîstraightforward selection events for int‚Äôl championships are #goodforthesport. Imagine how exciting the last three M&W events of, say, the Polish Championships would be with World/Oly berths on the line for the winner. & a week of meets like that in late June every year‚Äîwow!
‚ÄúYou‚Äù being the nation that has earned these spots, and not, like the athletes must host an event themselves, obviously. (In case that needs clarification.)

I‚Äôm not sure about this part, but I‚Äôm noodling on the idea that to claim these spots, you *must* host a Trials event‚Äîno BS politics, earn your spot on the tartan. But that may give an advantage to athletes from nations without these auto spots, who don‚Äôt have to peak twice.

Finish 1st country overall, you send 3 in all events (M&W). Finish 2nd overall, you send 2 in all events, finish 3rd you send one. Finish 1st in your area (outside of top-3 countries overall), you send 1 in 3 events of your choice (both M & W), 2nd choose 2 events, 3rd choose 1.
I‚Äôll say it again‚Äîcountries should earn the *right* to host a Trials, based on cumulative team score at the last cycle of WCs/Olys/Area Champs (with weighting for global over area).

@Dipen215 (And even those wages are actually paid by MLB clubs‚ÄîMiLB clubs don‚Äôt  pay their on-field talent.)

@Dipen215 T&F can definitely learn a lot from MiLB marketing/promotions/community outreach, but MiLB‚Äôs success is built on paying its players poverty wages‚Äî$8k-$14k/year on avg‚Äîthat drives talent from the sport. And, unfortunately, T&F already has that part covered.

@TheRealMerb Also how every race is a unique snowflake. That $65k they have to pay to cover the field is a big expense! But it‚Äôs what I takes to finish on the field, which is core to their event. Most major events have something(s) like that. That any happen at all is a near-miracle.

@TheRealMerb Thoughts:
-kudos the them for investing $250k towards the pro race!
-$360k for all printed materials, including shirts, means they‚Äôre getting a great deal on shirts‚Äîcould easily spend that on shirts alone
-interesting the food bag is in the mktg budget‚Äîlikely a good chunk of it

We asked active minor league baseball players what a living wage would mean to them. Currently, minor leaguers make between $4,800-$16,000 a year. 

Their responses showcase the brutal reality of being a professional athlete making poverty-level wages...üßµ

@bbculp @timed_trials @erinstrout @RunFlyingPig But, shit, maybe I‚Äôm the one shooting from the hip here? I‚Äôm definitely thinking on that‚Äînot my intent to disparage you or your work.

@bbculp @timed_trials @erinstrout @RunFlyingPig I‚Äôm aware of who you are and your (overwhelmingly good and thoughtful) work, Brad. Which is why I‚Äôm surprised by your replies here? They‚Äôre on the right side, but (again, Twitter, so just throwing it out there without word-crafting) don‚Äôt show that same thoughtful consideration.
@bbculp @timed_trials @erinstrout @RunFlyingPig (‚ÄúDismissive‚Äù is a harsher word than intended.)

@bbculp @timed_trials @erinstrout @RunFlyingPig I get that this and Twitter and that‚Äôs a joke, but that‚Äôs actually really dismissive of how a good and thoughtful accommodations review policy and process can lead to a more inclusive race.

@erinstrout @bbculp @RunFlyingPig I don‚Äôt think that could be done so in a way that would satisfy the public, while stopping short of sharing sensitive information. (Which is a thought that I hold simultaneously and in tension with the idea that a bad thing clearly happened here.)
@bbculp @RunFlyingPig Which, to be clear, isn‚Äôt to this was a good outcome.
@bbculp @RunFlyingPig I would argue that there‚Äôs a reasonable expectation that any correspondence‚Äîwhich needn‚Äôt solely be documents‚Äîabout a person‚Äôs health would remain private.

@bbculp @RunFlyingPig I also think, while the merits of this case seem clear after the fact, that an unfortunate outcome from this sort of blowback could be races becoming more stringent in their accommodations evaluation policies, leading to races becoming less inclusive.

@bbculp @RunFlyingPig While I understand the urge to ask for this, I‚Äôm not sure that a satisfying discussion of this can be had publicly. It may involve documents and correspondence that include (physical and mental) health and fitness information that should rightfully remain private.
